text: 695037563 | FMC | 22874446 | | 015598 | 7/9/2000 12:00:00 AM | leg edema , anemia , proteinuria , ?NSAID gastritis , colonic polyps | | DIS | Admission Date: 7/9/2000 Report Status: Discharge Date: 5/2/2000 ****** DISCHARGE ORDERS ****** PEPPER , REX 724-59-56-9 Vivo Service: MED DISCHARGE PATIENT ON: 1/25 AT 03:00 PM CONTINGENT UPON Not Applicable WILL D/C ORDER BE USED AS THE D/C SUMMARY: YES Attending: KIRBO , RIGOBERTO W. , M.D. DISPOSITION: Home DISCHARGE MEDICATIONS: VENTOLIN ( ALBUTEROL INHALER ) 2 PUFF INH QID PRN wheezing , sob COLACE ( DOCUSATE SODIUM ) 100 MG PO BID LASIX ( FUROSEMIDE ) 100 MG PO BID NPH HUMULIN INSULIN ( INSULIN NPH HUMAN ) 20 U SC QPM Starting Today ( 7/18 ) HOLD IF: 1 )NPO 2 ) till scope is done REGULAR INSULIN ( HUMAN ) ( INSULIN REGULAR HUMAN ) Sliding Scale SC QAC & HS Call HO If BS > 400 For BS < 200 give 0 Units reg SC For BS from 201 to 250 give 4 Units reg SC For BS from 251 to 300 give 6 Units reg SC For BS from 301 to 350 give 8 Units reg SC For BS from 351 to 400 give 10 Units reg SC ZESTRIL ( LISINOPRIL ) 40 MG PO QD Override Notice: Override added on 9/8 by GLASSNER , VERNON D K. , M.D. on order for GOLYTELY PO ( ref # 50732217 ) POTENTIALLY SERIOUS INTERACTION: LISINOPRIL & POTASSIUM CHLORIDE Reason for override: noted Previous override information: Override added on 11/22 by ALTUM , ISIDRO ALFONSO , M.D. on order for KCL IMMEDIATE REL. PO ( ref # 46782625 ) POTENTIALLY SERIOUS INTERACTION: LISINOPRIL & POTASSIUM CHLORIDE Reason for override: aware Previous override information: Override added on 7/06 by WOODYARD , TOD MILFORD , M.D. on order for KCL IV ( ref # 07258083 ) POTENTIALLY SERIOUS INTERACTION: LISINOPRIL & POTASSIUM CHLORIDE Reason for override: will monitor Previous override information: Override added on 7/06 by STAMPS , RICK RANDY , M.D. on order for KCL IMMEDIATE REL. PO ( ref # 78542757 ) POTENTIALLY SERIOUS INTERACTION: LISINOPRIL & POTASSIUM CHLORIDE Reason for override: will monitor REGLAN ( METOCLOPRAMIDE HCL ) 10 MG PO BID Starting Today ( 7/18 ) Instructions: take with lasix to increase absorption PRILOSEC ( OMEPRAZOLE ) 20 MG PO QD CARDURA ( DOXAZOSIN ) 4 MG PO BID AVANDIA ( ROSIGLITAZONE ) 8 MG PO QD KCL SLOW RELEASE 20 MEQ X 2 PO QD As per MBMC Potassium Chloride Policy: each 20 mEq dose to be given with 4 oz of fluid Alert overridden: Override added on 1/25 by : POTENTIALLY SERIOUS INTERACTION: LISINOPRIL & POTASSIUM CHLORIDE Reason for override: will monitor DIET: House / ADA 1800 cals/dy RETURN TO WORK: Not Applicable FOLLOW UP APPOINTMENT( S ): Dr. Rajewski 3:45pm 6/15 scheduled , ALLERGY: Erythromycins , Penicillins , Cortisone acetate ADMIT DIAGNOSIS: leg edema , anemia , proteinuria PRINCIPAL DISCHARGE DIAGNOSIS ;Responsible After Study for Causing Admission ) leg edema , anemia , proteinuria , ?NSAID gastritis , colonic polyps OTHER DIAGNOSIS;Conditions , Infections , Complications , affecting Treatment/Stay IDDM HTN nephrotic sdm Fe def anemia CHF ( EF 40-45% on OPERATIONS AND PROCEDURES: Upper GI: NSAID gastritis , hiatal hernia Colonoscopy: Polyps that appeared benign , no evidence of bleeding OTHER TREATMENTS/PROCEDURES ( NOT IN O.R. ) Blood transfusions ( three units total ) Diuresis with IV lasix BRIEF RESUME OF HOSPITAL COURSE: *** 11/22 *** 60 y.o woman c dm , htn , hyperlipidemia , nephrotic syndrome p/w worsening 3+ le edema up to thighs and lower abdomen. No cp , sob , palpitations , dysuria , change in urination. Protein loss in 10 of September around 6g/day. Also Hct decrease in past months , guaiac + stool in ED. Admitted for diuresis and possible GI workup. ____________________________________________________________ *** 6/10 *** colonoscopy today: mult ( about 10 ) polyps in colon , largest one 1cm , no active bleeding. No polyp bx taken , given so numerous and Pt on ASA and lovenox. Nodular gastritis w/ few erosions , no ulcers. Gastric bx pending. Pt to get repeat colonoscopy in February w/ bx of polyps , after d/c asa , lovenox. Sent home on 100 mg BID po Lasix with 10mg BID po Reglan to increase absorption , on rest of cardiac meds ( Zestril , Cardura ) , on Avandia and Humalin 20 Units. Avoid NSAIDS and ASA. PCP will adjust diuretic regimen as pt. responds. ADDITIONAL COMMENTS: Please visit Dr. Tischer or come back to AH if leg edema worsens with diuretic use at home or if notice blood in stools. DISCHARGE CONDITION: Stable TO DO/PLAN: Follow up with Dr. Lineberger tomorrow 3:45pm at Lis Rirock Ton Medical Center . Follow up with GI at RHO in 2 months for colonic polyps. Avoid NSAIDs , Aspirin Follow-up H.pylori study. Adjust diuretic regimen as needed. Pt. aware of fluid restriction need of about 1.5L/day and plan. No dictated summary ENTERED BY: HULMES , LEONEL DANNIE , M.D. ( YS58 ) 1/25 @ 02:34 PM ****** END OF DISCHARGE ORDERS ******
